snippet: Nigeria’s National Human Rights Commission said Monday that it had found that security agents were responsible for the unlawful killings of eight civilians in a September raid in Abuja, the Nigerian capital.
abstract: Nigeria's National Human Rights Commission says it has found that security agents were responsible for unlawful killings of eight civilians in Sept 2013 raid in Abuja on Boko Haram terrorist network.
lead_paragraph: Nigeria’s National Human Rights Commission said Monday that it had found that security agents were responsible for the unlawful killings of eight civilians in a September raid in Abuja, the Nigerian capital.

headline.main: Nigeria: Civilians Were Killed by Security Agents, Panel Says
headline.print_headline: Nigeria: Civilians Were Killed by Security Agents, Panel Says

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
